metadata.title: CVE-2020-15658 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The code for downloading files did not properly take care of specialcharacters, which led to an attacker being able to cut off the file endingat an earlier position, leading to a different file type being downloadedthan shown in the dialog. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.1,Firefox < 79, and Thunderbird < 78.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15658` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
